businessLogic.util

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • businessLogic.util.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    The Timer class contains methods to start, finish and retrieve the time.

    It can be instantiated and use multiple timers at once.

    Author:
    Ferran Tudela

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      long getCurrentMillisTime()
      Get the current time in milliseconds
      long getCurrentNanoTime()
      Get the current time in nanosecond
      long getFinishMillisTime()
      Get the finish time in milliseconds If the timer is still running it will stop it
      long getFinishNanoTime()
      Get the finish time in nanosecond If the timer is still running it will stop it
      java.lang.String getFormattedCurrentTime()
      Get the time string with the format "h m s"
      java.lang.String getFormattedFinishTime()
      Get the time string with the format "h m s".
      boolean isRunning()
      Return the running state of the timer

      Start the timer
      void stopTimer()
